section.name: Warning
section.p: The presence of the jsf-extensions-dev-time.jar in your WEB-INF/lib directory opens up a big security hole in your application, in the name of ease of development. Do not deploy your application into production with this jar in your WEB-INF/lib.

section.name: Usage
section.p: One oft cited complaint about Java Web Applications is the slow and laborious deployment step. This step seriously undermines the ability to get into a flow state and is generally a major buzz kill. The absense of a deployment step is one reason why people like Ruby on Rails so much.
JSF-Extensions Design time brings good news for flow-impaired Java Web application Developers: the JMX PhaseListener.

subsection.name: HowTo
subsection.p: Here's how to use this feature in to iteratively develop a JSF 1.2 application deployed via a "deploydir"-style deployment on a JMX enabled Java EE container, such as the Java EE SDK.

li.p: Download the jsf-extensions binary bundle from the "releases" folder.

ol.li: Unpack the binary, take the jsf-extensions-dev-time-<VERSION>.jar and drop it into your JSF application's WEB-INF/lib directory.

subsection.p: Upon receipt of a request with this URL, the PhaseListener will use JMX to stop and restart the application. This takes a fraction of the time that a full redeploy takes, yet all of the java classes in your app, as well as all of the config files, are re-loaded.

dl.dt: Note, due to a bug in glassfish, the web.xml is not re-loaded when this JMX method is used. A fix for this bug is in progress.

subsection.name: Reference
subsection.p: The JMXPhaseListener in jsf-extensions-dev-time supports the following options, specified as <context-param> elements in the web.xml. All of these parameters are optional and have sensible defaults.

dd.p: The password that must be given as the value of the password URL query parameter in the restart URL. If not specified the value of "adminadmin" (without the quotes) is assumed.
The JMX password. In most cases, this is equal to the admin password. If not specified, the value of "adminadmin" (without the quotes) is used.
The port on which the JMX server is listening. If not sprcified, the value of 4848 is used.
